revised_title: On the Density of Hydrogen in Palladium
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between hydrogen gas and palladium, finding that when palladium is charged with hydrogen, it undergoes significant expansion and the density of hydrogen in the alloy approaches that of magnesium. The expulsion of hydrogen from the palladium causes a permanent contraction of the metal. The density of hydrogen in the alloy appears to be nearly constant, regardless of the proportion of hydrogen in the alloy.
